body: This book is about the Devil’s youngest son, called Jinx, who isn’t good at being evil. His Dad, Satan, gives up on him and wants to send him to an army camp. Jinx runs away and finds that a girl his age has been sent to hell when that is not allowed. She is called Tommy and they make friends. They find out about a plot to destroy the wall between heaven and hell and get rid of Jinx’s Dad. They know they have to do something about it. This is a hilarious book and I kept on reading and couldn’t wait to read the sequel. Recommended reading age: 9 yrs and above.      You will like this book if you like: David Walliams’ books. How does it make me feel when reading it: It made me laugh a lot.  Buy this book at the Guardian Bookshop  Want to tell the world about a book you’ve read? Join the site and send us your review!
webTitle: The D’Evil Diaries by Tatum Flynn – review
